intro: Zaluzianskia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy sunflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the central and eastern United States. It features large, showy yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive yellow center and hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils in open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom from late summer to early fall. Zaluzianskia hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
